title: Facebook
definition: Facebook is primarily a social networking site that enables users to connect with friends, family, and communities.

title: TikTok
definition: Launched in 2016 by the Chinese company ByteDance, it has gained immense popularity for its engaging content and user-friendly interface.

title: Instagram
definition: Instagram allows users to upload and share photos and videos, which can be edited with various filters and effects.

title: Shopee
definition: Shopee is a leading online shopping platform that specializes in e-commerce, catering to a wide range of products and services.

title: Lazada
definition: Lazada was founded by Maximilian Bittner in 2012, with the aim of creating an Amazon-like marketplace in Southeast Asia.

title: Iphone
definition: iPhones run on Apple's iOS, which is known for its smooth performance, user-friendly interface, and regular updates.

title: Github
definition: GitHub is a web-based platform that facilitates software development and version control using Git. It allows developers to store, manage, and collaborate on code projects.

title: Youtube
definition: YouTube is a popular online video sharing platform that allows users to upload, view, and share videos.

title: Paymaya
definition: With features like high-interest savings accounts, instant loans, credit cards, and QR payments, Maya aims to provide a seamless financial experience for its users.

title: Visual Studio Code
definition: VSCode is available on Windows, macOS, and Linux, allowing developers to use it on their preferred operating systems.
